edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:30): the TAG also his the wrong impression that changing the syntax is changing the design of the language
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:30): quite fascinating

8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (20:56): dangit dangit dangit
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:57): wonders what brought on such a triple-danging
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (20:58): sending the msft postMessage feedback from the wrong address, triggering moderation on the whatwg@ list
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (20:59): at this point I really should just give up, but then I make it slightly harder to filter the list into a folder
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:00): Doesn't filtering on from=<email/> work just as effectively?
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (21:01): I haven't looked
11f86dffc864538f568a9d0cc598fd93 (21:16): Hixie: around?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:29): I now realize that my outline for an token interning function was incredibly na?Øve
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:29): the one I sent to the list
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:29): but the observation was good
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:29): what to do with that observation was bad
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:30): Hixie: do you happen to have lists of all known SVG and MathML element names? What about attributes?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:30): Hixie: also, do you already have the half-assed list of HTML elements?
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (21:33): MikeSmith: fyi, feedback sent to whatwg
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:41): hmm, per the new magic the tokenizer needs to know the current node and all
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:50): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: did the spec change land already?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:51): no, hixie updated the wiki page
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:52): i should investigate the CDATA stuff better
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:52): maybe simon was right and it would be relatively safe to enable it everywhere causing less to authors trying to grasp the nonsense, etc.
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (21:53): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, I've seen links to pages which list element names and attributes. trying to track them down again
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:53): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, at this point you reached multifail btw with your doctype stuff, either string can be null per spec
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:55): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: argh. my spec snapshot is out of date then
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (21:56): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, mathml stuff from Hixie: http://damowmow.com/temp/mml
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:56): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I'm 100% certain the spec has been in a state where they can never be null
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:56): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, are you sure? they're explicitly set to the empty string during tokenization (initially they're "missing")
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:57): CDATA breakage: http://www.kozlika.org/kozeries/post/2007/10/07/A-quai
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (21:57): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, another mathml thing here: http://junkyard.damowmow.com/308
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:57): search for "rdf:RDF"

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:58): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: "the publicId attribute set to the public identifier given in the DOCTYPE token, or the empty string if the public identifier was not set"
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:58): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I'm not totally failing
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:58): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: hence, the tokenizer can emit null but a null never ends up in the tree
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:58): but i want it to end up in the serializer format
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:59): i think
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:59): it affects mode sniffing
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (21:59): for one
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:59): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: mode is out-of-DOM-band data
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:00): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: what's the point with that trickery around RDF?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:01): i try not to comprehend the Web :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:01): I sure hope that anti-pattern doesn't come from a blogging tool and is the doing of a single template writer on one blog
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:03): I wonder if I should cut a release of the parser with all the chardet goodness before the namespace stuff lands
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:03): Loads of people do <script type="text/javascript"><!--//--><![CDATA[//><!--
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:03): Uh, loads who are on tripod.com anyway
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:03): <script> doesn't matter
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:04): as in, <script> parsing would not even hit <![CDATA[
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:05): what does "move the insertion mode flag to before the tokeniser " mean?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:06): i think it means introducing the concept before the tokenizer instead of after
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:06): looks like "in namespace" *really* is a boolean flag and not a real insertion mode enumeration value
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:06): (because it will be used in the tokenizer, presumably)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:07): Hixie: please make "in namespace" a "mode flag" or somesuch instead of an insertion mode
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:07): http://www.biludlejningaarhus.dk
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:07): (uses CDATA in a way that breaks Opera)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:08): http://pl.samsungmobile.com/ - <script id="ssInfo" type="text/xml" warning="DO NOT MODIFY!"> - hmm
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:09): analyzing the Web stuff out there doesn't build confidence in the general competence of Web developers...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:09): ah, Mozilla has different error handling for CDATA that breaks MSDN: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=305242
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:09): that's why I was confused
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:10): http://www.jcu.edu.au/business/ does the same DO NOT MODIFY thing
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:11): http://www.eragintza.net/ - I don't quite know what's going on there
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:16): mad guessing skills: http://damowmow.com/temp/svg

11f86dffc864538f568a9d0cc598fd93 (22:18): Hixie: when you get a chance... I'm curious why Storage.removeItem(key) doesn't cause a StorageEvent to be emitted.  Or at least I can't figure out where it's mandated in the spec
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:19): it appears that HTML, SVG and MathML only use ascii letters and hyphen-minus in element names
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:19): <select1> would be a departure from that

42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (22:23): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, SVG 1.1 spec has element index http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/eltindex.html and attributes index http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/attindex.html
